intro: Schleidenia fumana, commonly known as the smoky ghostplant, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating, giving it a smoky appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Schleidenia fumana is native to southern Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to grow in humid, temperate climates.
